_header: When Rome is removed into England
Note: All MSS show considerable variations, but derive from an original short prophecy, Scottish in sympathy, developing some of the symbols used by Geoffrey of Monmouth.
Bibliographic Ghosts: London, Westminster Abbey 27 : not in this manuscript or too faded to detect.
_description: The Second Scottish Prophecy, the A Text — in couplets

CULKk15.First Lines:
QWhen Rome Is removyde in to InglandeAnd the prest haffys the
                    poppys powre in hande…
CULKk15.Last Lines:
…And oþer burghys abowte wytht þar brade wallSall
                    wytht þe lyoune be leff ande longe for euer
CULKk15.Note: 71 lines in rough couplets, some incomplete.
CULKk15.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Historical Poems of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         New York: Columbia UP, 1959: 118.
Stevenson,  Joseph. 
             The Scottish Metrical Romance of Lancelot du Lak.
Maitland Club
         48. Edinburgh, 1839: 157.
Lumby,  Joseph Rawson,
                        ed.  
             Bernardus De Cura Rei Famuliaris, with some early Scottish
                Prophecies.
EETS
         o.s. 42 (1870); repr. 1965.

BLHar559.First Lines:
When Rome is Remevyd into InglandAnd euerye prist hathe popes power
                    In hand…
BLHar559.Last Lines:
…Covetous & Lecherye is the viceThen shall it bene
                    Lyfe
BLHar559.Note:
Fragment: 7 lines only. Seven lines rhyming aaaabbb; followed on f.
                        10v by prose prophecy of similar content set out in lines but
                    unrhyming except for one embedded couplet(?).

BLSl2578.First Lines: when rome is removid in to englande& euery preste hathe the popes power in hande…
BLSl2578.Last Lines: …Be þat yeare of the lorde com & gonein the lande of albion shalbe myche confusion
BLSl2578.Note: Written as prose; continues in prose to 75v, including echos of other prophecies including 6434, then ends “finis.”
